unnormalised: ## Payment Gateways: Because Who Carries Cash Anymore, Beta?
normalised: ## Payment Gateways: Because Who Carries Cash Anymore, Beta?

unnormalised: So, you're running your online sari shop, "Silk & Spice, By Priya" – congrats! But selling those gorgeous Kanjeevarams isn't just about having a stunning website, is it? You need a way to actually *get paid*, otherwise you're just running a very expensive Instagram feed. That's where payment gateways swoop in, like a Bollywood hero saving the day from… well, empty bank accounts.
normalised: So, you're running your online sari shop, "Silk and Spice, By Priya" – congrats! But selling those gorgeous Kanjeevarams isn't just about having a stunning website, is it? You need a way to actually *get paid*, otherwise you're just running a very expensive Instagram feed. That's where payment gateways swoop in, like a Bollywood hero saving the day from… well, empty bank accounts.

unnormalised: Think of a payment gateway as the super-efficient middleman between you, your customer, and the bank. It’s basically the electronic version of your trusty halwai bhaiya at Diwali, accepting all those crisp Rs. 500 notes and making sure everyone gets their laddoos (or, in your case, saris). They handle all the complicated stuff – security, encryption, and generally preventing digital chori-chakaari. Nobody wants their credit card info leaked on the internet, right? That’s worse than finding an elaichi in your biryani!

They handle all the complicated stuff – security, encryption, and generally preventing digital chori-chakaari. Nobody wants their credit card info leaked on the internet, right? unnormalised: Choosing the right gateway is crucial. There's Razorpay, PayU, CCAvenue… more options than sweets at a Bangalore wedding! You need one that accepts all the usual culprits: credit cards, debit cards, net banking, UPI… even that weird "international rupees" thing your cousin Rajesh uses from his Canada life.

unnormalised: Don't just pick the cheapest one, okay? Think about transaction fees – are they going to eat up all your profits? And what about customer support? You want someone you can call at 3 am when Mrs. Sharma from Delhi is having trouble paying for her Onam pattu. Remember that time Auntie Meena’s online payment for her flight to Kerala got stuck? We don't want a repeat of *that* drama!

unnormalised: So, do your research, compare those fees, and choose wisely. Because in the wild world of e-commerce, a good payment gateway is your best friend – after your mom, of course. She always knows the best deals.
